name: Royal Kahana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here in March in unit #1210 during whale season. This was our 4th trip to Maui and our first at this condo. It was a 2B/2-1/2 bath with lots of room. This is an older condo complex and not a resort. We like having a kitchen to prepare meals in since my DH has a food allergy. The kitchen in this unit was updated and had the basics for preparing meals plus some plastic storage containers which came in handy.
reviews.title: Good place to stay and see the whales in season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfy, tvs in every room and the wrap around lanai was just awesome. You could look outside and see whales in any direction. That was the big plus for this place.
reviews.title: Home away from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's on the beach and there are turtles that frequent the waters below. That was fun watching them each day. The beach runs south for a short while but eventually comes to an end. It's an ok beach, not great. There is no beach to the north. Not sure I would call it a swimming beach. We found much better beaches to the south.
reviews.title: Amazing view - 1106

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: The washer and dryer came in handy since you only get maid service mid-stay otherwise they charge you. They also charge you if you want to switch out towels before maid service. Kind of annoying. So we had to do laundry, which was fine we had the time.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also charge you for internet service, so that's an extra charge. We ended up paying for a month's worth of service since that was cheaper than by the day.
reviews.title: Second Stay and still satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved our oceanfront view in room 311!!!!! The wraparound lanai was fabulous. Everything about our stay was wonderful. We booked through [--]
reviews.title: Loved the Royal Kahana

likes.liked: — Oceanfront to a nice sandy beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice people at the front desk, especially "Tim". Was upgraded to an oceanview free of charge. This hotel/condos was very clean, quiet and comfortable. I have nothing but good things to report. We had the best time. Our room was cleaned to perfection daily and they even washed a couple glasses we had left in the sink. We would definitely stay here again. The price is good for Maui where almost everything is expensive. But wow, what a view from our balcony, unfortunatly we missed Whale season but I am told that you can see them right from your room. You won't be disappointed by staying here unless you are used to only staying at places like the Ritz or the Hyatt.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: we just returned from our trip to Maui. We absolutely loved our room at the Royal Kahana. We stayed in Unit 510 which is a 2 bedroom 2 1/2 bath oceanfront condo. The view from the Lanai is great especially for the Maui sunsets. The condo was nicely decorated and well kept. We have stayed at the Royal Kahana before in another oceanfront unit. We prefer the oceanfront units to the other units. If you plan to stay at the Royal Kahana, the oceanfront units are the way to go. Aloha!
reviews.title: perfect sunsets
Royal Kahana
reviews.text: wonderful place - we booked a studio and were upgraded to a one bedroom. Had a view of the oean and gardens - so peaceful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Went to sleep with the ocean breezes and sound of waves...
reviews.title: Wonderful place

likes.liked: — clean place and friendly staff and of course beside the beach

reviews.title: A wonderful stay at the Royal Kahana
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Maui for our 5th anniversary from September 25 to October 5, 2007. After reading a large number of reviews, we chose to stay at the Royal Kahana, and we weren't disappointed at all!

reviews.title: Better than I thought
reviews.text: We stayed in Condo 1215, a beautiful one-bedroom ocean-view. The condo was equipped with a full kitchen (as well as appliances and utensils) along with a washer, dryer and dishwasher. It is located in Kahana (just a few minutes North of Lahaina on the west side of Maui). The room was comfortable and clean and unless a "Privacy" sign was on the door, the cleaning staff would clean and re-stock the condo every day (including doing the dishes!). The resort also has a pool and beach towels are provided by the resort (so you can change them daily for fresh ones!) Also, to alleviate some other concerns I read in reviews, we didn't see any bugs (with the exception of a dead cricket on the lanai), but we did catch a small lizard in our room on our last night there! (small meaning not as big as a penny).

reviews.title: First time on Maui
reviews.text: The staff was always polite and courteous and there was always someone available at the main desk in the lobby. Also, there is an Expedia travel office at the resort if you need to book activities. Most of the prices they quoted were quite a bit cheaper than what I saw anywhere online, so you might want to check them out! The Expedia reps were really helpful and even provided a short introduction to the island and it's activities during our first day so we wouldn't miss a thing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The view from the lanai was incredible! Being an ocean-view, the left side of the view was of neighboring resorts, but on the right side we had a great view of the ocean and distant islands. The beach at the condo isn't really anything special unless you have small kids who want to play in the quiet waters. I would recommend travelling a few minutes North to the best beach we discovered in the area... the D.T. Fleming beach park! The waves here are pretty big (great for boogie boarding) and the beach is quite large. There is also ample parking and facilities available (both of which are hard to find at many of the beaches around Lahaina). Another beach I would recommend is the LONG stretch of Ka'anapali Beach (including Black Rock- a great snorkeling spot). The waves here aren't very intense, so if you just prefer swimming out, this is probably the beach for you.
reviews.title: Great room, view, and price!
Great Deal for a Budgeted Trip
reviews.text: The weather in Kahana is a little on the breezy side, but we found that if you didn't like the weather in one place, a 5 minute drive in either direction brings a drastic change! Lahaina is HOT with very little breeze to speak of.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 714 - gorgeous! This is a condo property and so the "rooms" are really apartments. Our room was beautifully decorated, had a washer/dryer, full kitchen, huge living room, dining area and large bathroom/closet area. Great balcony, too! Make sure you get a room that faces the ocean - we could see Lanai clearly and the sunsets were excellent. Our room was not ready when we arrived (at noon) so we stowed our luggage at the desk and had lunch. They called us when the room was ready - about 2pm. There is no maid service here, but that's okay. We only stayed 3 nights so there wasn't much housekeeping needed. Highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms; great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from 3 weeks in Maui where we stayed at the Royal Kahana for the second year. We had a one bedroom oceanview condo on the 11th floor with a great view of Molokai. The condo was more than adequate and very roomy, the carpet could have been cleaned before we got there but apart from this we have no complaints. We couldn't use our stove the first day due to wrong burner saucers but this was fixed as soon as we mentioned to the front desk. All staff members were very friendly and always ready to help with a smile. A special thank you to Vandetta (administration) who helped us with the Wi-Fi as the signal was very poor. The pool area can get crowded but there is always room on the lawn. This year was a little (well maybe a lot) more windy than last year but the whales and turtles that we could see from our lanai were everyday a bonus and made up for the breeze...
reviews.title: Great location and great vacations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We do agree with other "tenants" that, yes, the building is getting old and that some updates should be considered. Having said that we are looking forward to our next stay next February for 4 weeks
reviews.title: "Good location, but not what we expected"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would also mention Chip and Rebeca, the concierges. We met Rebeca last year and were glad to see that she was there this year also. Chip and Rebeca arranged some great days of discovery on Maui and also in Pearl Harbor. They are a source of information and good ideas, we are already planning our adventures for next year.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marie-Jo C
reviews.title: Wonderful Views & Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I normally do not write negative reviews but I thought it was necessary in this case.
reviews.title: Not worth the money at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our stay was just ok. The building was old looking. The furnishings were a little ratty looking and were quite sparse. We had the comforter off of the bed the entire time because it just didn't look clean. The blankets and sheets on the bed were really thin.
reviews.title: Exceptional, much better than expected - and I expected plenty!

likes.liked: — high quality, clean accomodations with a friendly, skilled staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was a good size and seemed to be pretty clean.
reviews.title: Great value

likes.liked: — spacious, clean, view, service, free parking
likes.disliked: — wished there was a morning continental breakfast in lobby every morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good thing about the room was the washer and dryer in the room. However, our washer malfunctioned and actually ripped a number of my clothes! (I'm sure this doesn't happen to everyone though! Just be careful if you are in 616!)
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Big rooms and right on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were ok..the maids were ok..(Though I asked for more coffee and never received it the entire time we were there!)
reviews.title: Nice place for a nice price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our first "big" family vacation (and the first time our kids were on an airplane) was made whole by a week at this very enjoyable establishment.
reviews.title: Great Establishment, Especially For Families
Affordable - look around for closer to the action
reviews.text: The view from your living room will knock you on your backside, and if you are looking for an extended stay in one location, you cannot beat having a kitchen and a washer/dryer in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Furthermore, you cannot beat the location. Lahaina is ten minutes out, shopping and restaurants are within walking distance, and a grocery store is less than five minutes away.
reviews.title: Can't be beat for the price!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, we enjoyed the great beaches within ten minutes drive (Napili, Honolua Bay). And a nice, small family beach immediately outside the hotel, with little-kid friendly surf (ankle-high for grown-ups).
reviews.title: Not the best
Very good value!
reviews.text: Highly recommended. Clean, comfortable, and as family friendly as they come.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for our Anniversary, apart from the wild windy weather , we enjoyed our stay, the room was great , huge big comfortable bed, massive fridge with ice maker in freezer, lovely balcony with view ( of whales aswell ) ,lovley beach, great swimming pool area, wish we stayed here for another week
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We went on a girls trip and stayed in unit 510 in March 2012. It was a corner unit with a wrap-around lanai. It was a clean and spacious 2 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom (an on-suite bathroom in each room) with very comfy beds. The building was quiet and well-appointed, across from a small store, and in walking to a few restaurants. The beach was also right there. The unit itself had everything you'd need for comfort and utility in terms of a stocked kitchen (minus food but plus spices), washer-dryer, plenty of towels, including beach towels, etc...There is no view from the second bedroom and the bathroom there could use a definite upgrade in terms of shower head and toilet seat, etc...
reviews.title: Fantastic Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kicker for this spot was definitely the view...it was perfect. We watched gorgeous sunsets right from the lanai, no obstruction to the view at all. We were able to see whales in the distance, turtles right below and two other islands not far off on each side. The condo was always bright and sunny...quiet evenings with the waves crashing below.
reviews.title: Impractical luxury. Maybe in 40 years, this will be my kind of place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The on-site restaurant was just...well i don't know. It closed early the first time we tried to go in because business was slow ("sorry, we're not serving food anymore today" at 2pm). The second time, in spite of a sign displaying credit cards logos, we were told it was cash only and were sent away. Luckily, as mentioned, there are other places nearby.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in a very convenient condo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in 710, a rather stuffily appointed but very spacious condo with a wraparound balcony. Unfortunately, despite the palatial furnishings and view, this unit compared somewhat poorly with a less luxurious unit we stayed in down in Honokowai for the first part of our Maui vacation.
reviews.title: Nice place, but be aware before you rent there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you want luxury hotels and crowds, this place is not for you. Building is typical 70's-80's Maui. High rise-12 floors, but it is oceanfront. Booked thru Costco vacations, 1 BR oceanfront (not oceanview) for 2 adults and 2 tweens during Spring Break week. Since each unit is individually owned and appointed, you don't know what you are getting until you check in. Stayed 8 days in unit 309. We were pleasantly surprised. Though the unit needs updating, it has all the usual amenities. King bed is comfortable, sofa sleeper has thin mattress. Unit is clean, carpet in decent shape with no stains. Bathroom clean, and kitchen dated but clean. A one time maid service was included. Nice to be able to have a kitchen, refrigerator, microwave, washer, dryer, etc.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view is awesome from this unit. Can see Molokai across the channel. We were able to see whales and dolphins in the distance. Bring binoculars. Added bonus: turtles feeding just offshore for hours.
reviews.title: Older, Clean but not perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Minimal interaction with staff, but they were friendly. Did not use the concierge desk, but it appears you can book attractions in the lobby. Small fitness room with 5-6 pieces of equipment, and a ping pong table.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a snack bar onsite with limited hours and menu. McDonald's and Black Angus just a few hundred yards walk away, along with a dive shop to rent gear. Plenty of free onsite parking. 5 minute drive north of Kaanapali. We like being away from the crowds and hustle and bustle of Lahaina and Kaanapali, but close enough to drive there. If that's what you like, Kahana is a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Not what we expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as our second time to Maui for 1 week starting March 16, 2013. Our first initial impression was not that great but later realized many of the great things about our stay here. Since this is a condo, we have to identify we stayed in a studio room 602.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

description: Make yourself at home in Kahana. This beachfront community is the calm cousin to West Maui’s high-profile destinations of Lahaina, Kaanapali and Kapalua Resort. You won’t find the typical string of Maui hotels, dazzling storefronts, and streams of shoppers and diners – although that’s only a few minutes away if the mood strikes. Instead, step into casual comfort at Outrigger Royal Kahana, a pleasant Maui condo that takes full advantage of its discreet Kahana setting. Welcome the sun on a morning stroll chasing waves along the sand. Breathe in the breeze that sweeps across the ocean view from your high-rise lanai. Marvel at humpback whales slapping and rolling so close to shore!
